Acrochordon commonly know as skin tags is extra skin growth commonly seen on face, neck, underarms. It’s usually painless and harmless so ignored by the patients until they are all over n end up giving bad esthetic impression. Don’t wait till you reach there. Skin tag removal is very quick and comfortable procedure. Don’t delay it!!

The combination of micro needling & sonophoresis (use of ultrasound to deliver actives into the skin) helps deliver actives deeper into the skin that are not possible by application of creams or microneedling alone. This combination of technologies gives superior results in skin brightening, skin texture improvement, hydration, anti-aging and scar improvement. There’s no pain or downtime only great results! Do enquire about this treatment the next time you’re in the clinic.  Acne scars if treated early on can be prevented from converting into dents. This treatment can be done even when patients are on oral isotretinoin in which fractional laser treatments cannot be done.

A HIFU (High Intensity Focused Ultrasound) uses ultrasound to create heat at a deep level in the skin. This heat causes controlled damage of targeted skin cells & deeper tissues, causing the body to try to repair them. To do this, the body clears the treated tissue & produces new collagen to aid in cell regrowth. Collagen is a substance in the skin that gives it structure and elasticity.
HIFU can achieve some of the following 
* tighten the skin on the neck
* reduce the appearance of jowls
* lift drooping eyelids or eyebrows
* smooth wrinkles on the face
* smooth and tighten chest skin

Each session typically lasts 90 minutes.
Some people report mild discomfort during the treatment, and some have mild tightening sensation afterward. A local anesthetic cream before the procedure can help minimize discomfort. Over-the-counter pain relievers, such as paracetamol may be given to those who have low pain threshold.

When a session is over, there is also no recovery time, which means that people can get on with their daily activities after receiving HIFU treatment.
People may require between one and six sessions, depending on the results they want to achieve. Sessions are spaced at 6 month intervals. 
Results vary depending on the device, the settings used & skill of the provider. In our clinic treatment is administered by doctors who are well trained & experienced with the procedure.

social_posts.post_text: Laser hair removal in our clinic. Only the best technologies for great results. Suitable for both men & women. Results visible within the first few sessions. 6 to 8 sessions can result in reduction of all coarse hair. Minimal discomfort and no downtime. Suitable for all skin tones. Perfectly suitable for those prone to rashes and side effects from waxing and shaving like rashes, boils and ingrowths.

Never apply caustic substances (lemon, chuna, garlic, toothpaste) to birth marks! This girl applied a caustic substance in an attempt to get rid of her birth mark on the nose. It only ended up causing scarring. Certain birth marks can be treated with a laser and they’re easier to treat when flat. Scarring causes textural irregularities making it much harder to treat. However, with our Alma Q laser we were able to give this girl a satisfactory reduction with just one session. We hope to clear it out in the next few sessions.

The CMSlim uses powerful electromagnetic waves to stimulate muscle and burn fat. The result is similar to High Intensity Interval training (HIIT) wherein the fat continues to burn even after the exercise is stopped. There is a 15 to 20% muscle gain in treatment areas improving tone and definition. For those who don’t work out 2 sessions per week for 3 weeks can reduce fat. For those who work out once a week treatment in addition to their exercise routine will maximise the benefits of exercise. Results are seen within 2 months of treatment. Sessions can be repeated after 2 to 3 months of break. The best part is there’s no downtime; you can go back to your routine or exercise the very same day. A calorie deficit diet plus regular physical activity will maximise the benefits of treatment. The abdomen, thighs, glutes and arms are the areas that can be treated.

Striae commonly known as Stretch marks are type of scars that appears due to stretching or shrinking of skin. Causes can be pregnancy, rapid weight gain or weight loss, puberty, weight trainings etc
Early you start treating it better will be the result. There are certain combinations that works like tretinoin applications, peels, radio frequency. 
Here we are performing fractional CO2 laser for scar revision.it helps to make hypertrophic scars more uniform and resurfacing improves skin texture as well as pigment.

Thrilled to share that we have installed the Motus AX hair removal laser in the clinic. The first in Mumbai! It is an Alexandrite laser 755nm wavelength considered the gold standard for laser hair removal. It’s is manufactured by Deka lasers Europe’s top aesthetics manufacturer. The proprietary Moveo technology ensures a pain-free (truly pain-free!) yet effective hair reduction experience. Effective on all hair thicknesses (as long as the hair is dark) and safe for all skin tones. Did my beard shaping on it and I can vouch that it’s truly pain free! We’re the only clinic in India to have three leading world-class lasers under one roof including Soprano Titanium & the Gentle YAG Pro U.

Witnessing a remarkable transformation! This patient of ours underwent successful depigmentation therapy for vitiligo, and the results are truly inspiring! As a doctor, moments like these make me cherish my profession even more.  Depigmentation therapy is typically recommended for those with widespread vitiligo.

During depigmentation therapy, a topical cream containing monobenzone or another depigmenting agent is applied to the unaffected areas of the skin. This aims to lighten the remaining pigmented skin, so it matches the depigmented areas affected by vitiligo. The process usually takes several months to achieve the desired results.

It’s important to note that depigmentation therapy should be carefully considered in consultation with a dermatologist or healthcare professional. The treatment is typically reserved for cases where the vitiligo is extensive and significantly affects the person’s quality of life.  #dermatology #dermatologistconsultation #doctorconsultation #skinconsultation #doctors #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar 
#mumbai #skin #vitiligo #vitiligobeauty #vitiligoawareness #depigmentationtreatment

Shingrix is a vaccine used to protect against shingles, a painful and potentially serious viral infection caused by the varicella-zoster virus, which is the same virus that causes chickenpox. The vaccine is designed to boost the body’s immune response to the virus, reducing the risk of shingles and its complications.

It is a recombinant subunit vaccine, meaning it contains only a specific part of the virus rather than the whole virus. This makes it more effective and suitable for individuals with compromised immune systems.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the World Health Organization (WHO) recommend Shingrix as the preferred shingles vaccine for adults aged 50 years and older. The vaccine is usually administered in two doses, with the second dose given two to six months after the first dose.

It’s important to consult with a healthcare professional to determine if Shingrix is appropriate for you and to discuss any potential side effects or risks associated with the vaccine. #Shingrix #Vaccine #ShinglesProtection #StayProtected #Vaccination #Healthcare #ShinglesPrevention #VaccinesWork #HealthyLiving #ImmunityBoost #PublicHealth #HealthTips #Wellness #InfectiousDisease #HealthPrevention  #dermatology #dermatologistconsultation #doctorconsultation #skinconsultation #doctors #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar 
#mumbai

Step into a world where you have the power to sculpt your own beauty and unleash your inner confidence.

Facial augmentation isn’t just about changing your appearance; it’s about discovering your true self and embracing the beauty that has always been within you.

Facial augmentation with injectables is a non-surgical cosmetic procedure that uses dermal fillers to enhance facial features. The procedure starts with a consultation to grasp the patient’s goals and evaluate their facial structure. This guides the choice of filler, like hyaluronic acid-based or collagen-stimulating types. The filler is then accurately injected into targeted areas, providing volume and facial contouring.

Clear Skin Alert! Trifarotene has landed in India! 🇮🇳 Say goodbye to pesky zits and hello to confidence!

🌟 Introducing Trifarotene: The Future of Acne Treatment! 🌟

Struggling with stubborn acne, especially on your back and chest? Say hello to Trifarotene – the latest development in acne treatment that’s now available in India! 🇮🇳

🔍 What is Trifarotene?
Trifarotene is a cutting-edge topical retinoid specifically designed to target and treat acne, including the notorious truncal acne. It’s the first and only retinoid approved by the FDA for treating both facial and truncal acne.

🌱 How Does it Work?
Trifarotene works wonders by unclogging pores, reducing inflammation, and promoting cell turnover. This means bid farewell to those pesky pimples and hello to smoother, clearer skin.

Consult your dermatologist to see if Trifarotene is the right choice for you.

This is a common complaint among those undergoing fat loss treatments, that there are no results after a month or two of treatment. Fat loss treatments take time and multiple sessions to show results. The final result is a combination of fat loss and skin tightening. Individual results vary depending on genetics, age, lifestyle, exercise, diet, muscle mass, presence of insulin resistance,  the amount of fat before treatment, region of the body etc. Fat loss treatments show steady results over a prolonged period even after the recommended number of treatments are completed. The combination of technologies that are needed also vary between individuals. Results continue to develop over 4 to 6 months post treatment. In our experience fat loss among Indians is a little slower as compared to our western counterparts because of our largely sedentary lifestyle and low muscle mass. Nevertheless those who follow a consistent diet and regular physical activity do get great results🌟 Slow and Steady Wins the Race 🏃‍♀️💪🏼Fat loss treatments are a journey, not a sprint. Chillin’ with cryotherapy! ❄️ Cryotherapy is one of the treatment options for warts caused by the human papilloma virus on the palms and soles. It involves using extreme cold to freeze and destroy the tissue affected by the wart, leading to its removal. Here’s some information about cryotherapy for warts:

**Procedure:** During the procedure, a healthcare professional, often a dermatologist, applies liquid nitrogen or another cryogen onto the wart using a specialized device. The extreme cold causes the cells in the wart to freeze, which eventually leads to the death of the wart tissue.

**Process:** The freezing process might cause some discomfort or a stinging sensation, but it’s usually well-tolerated. After the treatment, a blister may form around the wart, and the dead tissue will gradually fall off over the course of a week or two.

**Effectiveness:** Cryotherapy is effective for most common warts and plantar warts (warts on the feet). However, multiple treatments might be required in some cases, especially for larger or more stubborn warts.

**Aftercare:** After the procedure, it’s important to follow the healthcare professional’s instructions for care. Keeping the treated area clean and dry and applying any recommended ointments can aid in healing.

**Side Effects:** Common side effects include pain, redness, swelling, and a blister forming around the treated area. Scarring is rare but can occur.

**Suitability:** Cryotherapy might not be suitable for certain individuals, such as those with poor circulation, certain skin conditions, or a weakened immune system. It’s best to consult a healthcare provider to determine the appropriate treatment for your specific situation.

As always, consulting a healthcare professional before undergoing any medical procedure is crucial to ensure that cryotherapy is the right choice for treating your warts.❄️❄️ #WartWoesNoMore #dermatology #dermatologistconsultation #doctorconsultation #skinconsultation #doctors #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar 
#mumbai #wart #cryotherapy #humanpapillomavirus

Gardasil is a vaccine that helps protect against certain strains of the human papillomavirus (HPV), which can cause various cancers and genital warts. Here are some key points about Gardasil:

1. Purpose: Gardasil is primarily used to prevent HPV infection, which is a common sexually transmitted infection. It specifically targets HPV types 16 and 18, which are responsible for most HPV-related cancers, as well as types 6 and 11, which cause genital warts.

2. HPV-Related Cancers: HPV is linked to several cancers, including cervical, anal, vaginal, vulvar, and some head and neck cancers. Gardasil vaccination can reduce the risk of these cancers.

3. Administration: Gardasil is typically administered in a series of two or three doses, depending on age and the specific Gardasil version used. The vaccine is typically given to adolescents and young adults.

4. Age Recommendations: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends routine Gardasil vaccination for both males and females at ages 11-12. Catch-up vaccinations are recommended for those who missed the initial series.

5. Effectiveness: Gardasil has been shown to be highly effective in preventing HPV-related diseases. However, it does not protect against all HPV types, so regular screening for cervical cancer is still recommended for women.

6. Safety: Gardasil is generally considered safe. Common side effects include pain or swelling at the injection site, fever, and dizziness. Serious side effects are rare.

8. Public Health Impact: Gardasil vaccination programs have contributed to a significant reduction in HPV-related diseases and cancers in many countries.

It's essential to consult with a healthcare provider to discuss the Gardasil vaccine's suitability for you or your child and to receive guidance on the recommended vaccination schedule and any potential side effects.  Gardasil vaccine is administered at our clinic. Please connect with the clinic for more information and to book appointments for vaccination.

Another non-steroidal topical medication crisaborole is now available in India. It’s role is in the active treatment or maintenance of mild to moderate eczema including atopic dermatitis, in both children and adults. Crisaborole is a phosphodiesterase 4 (PDE-4) inhibitor. It works by reducing inflammation and itching in the skin by inhibiting the PDE-4 enzyme, which plays a role in the inflammatory response. It has shown to be effective in reducing the signs and symptoms of eczema, including itching and redness. #crisaborole #skinhealth #nonsteroidal #drrickson #drricksonpereira #dermatologist #skindoctor #dermatologistconsultation

Bid farewell to those tired eyes and welcome the refreshed, youthful look with under eye fillers. 

Under eye fillers is a non-surgical procedure that involves the injection of specialized dermal fillers, typically composed of hyaluronic acid, into the hollow or sunken areas beneath the eyes. 

The purpose of this treatment is to reduce dark circles, minimize under eye bags and puffiness caused due to stress and other factors. 

Fillers for the under-eye area are generally considered safe when administered by a qualified and trained physician.

This is a before-after picture of a patient with severe psoriasis who was treated with biologics. He was responding poorly to conventional medicines that are used in psoriasis.  Biologics have revolutionized the management of psoriasis and they are increasingly becoming the first line management for psoriasis. They are a class of drugs made from living cells and target specific parts of the immune system involved in psoriasis. Biologics can be highly effective in treating moderate to severe psoriasis when other treatments have failed. Some common biologics used in psoriasis management include adalimumab, etanercept, infliximab, secukinumab and ixekizumab. Oral medicines that are used in psoriasis traditionally, suppressed multiple parts of the immune system, even those not involved specifically in psoriasis. 

These medications work by inhibiting specific inflammatory molecules or immune cells, reducing the symptoms of psoriasis and preventing further skin cell buildup. Biologics are typically administered via injections and usually require ongoing treatment to maintain results.

Compared to conventional immunosuppressants that were traditionally used in psoriasis, biologics are highly specific and effective. They require less monitoring and incidence of side effects are far lesser. They need to be taken once or twice in a month for maintenance and can be self-administered.  However, it’s important to note that biologics can have potential side effects, including increased risk of infections, so their use should be carefully monitored by a healthcare provider. Treatment decisions should be made on an individual basis, taking into account the patient's specific circumstances and medical history.  #psoriasis #psoriasistreatment #drrickson #drricksonpereira #dermatologist #skindoctor #dermatologistconsultation #dermatologistrecommended #mumbai #khar #bandra

Offer ends on 31st December 2023💃💫 #LipocelOffer #BodyConfidence  Lipocel is a non-invasive body contouring treatment that uses high-intensity focused ultrasound (HIFU) technology to target and reduce fat cells in specific areas of the body. Here’s some key information about Lipocel treatment:

1. **How it Works:** Lipocel works by delivering focused ultrasound energy deep into the fat tissue beneath the skin’s surface. This energy heats and destroys fat cells without harming the surrounding tissue.

2. **Target Areas:** Lipocel is commonly used to target areas with stubborn fat deposits, such as the abdomen, thighs, buttocks, and flanks (love handles).

3. **Non-Invasive:** One of its primary advantages is that it’s a non-surgical and non-invasive procedure. There are no incisions, needles, or anesthesia required.  4. **Results:** Patients typically start to see noticeable results within a few weeks after treatment, with optimal results appearing after a few months as the body naturally eliminates the damaged fat cells.

5. **Safety:** Lipocel is generally considered safe with minimal side effects, which may include temporary mild discomfort & puffiness at the treatment site.

6. **Duration:** The length of a Lipocel session varies depending on the target area but usually takes around 30 minutes to an hour per session.

7. **Number of Sessions:** Multiple sessions (average 3 sessions) may be recommended to achieve the desired results, depending on individual goals and the area being treated.

8. **Maintenance:** A healthy lifestyle, including proper diet and exercise, can help maintain the results of Lipocel treatment.

The Omega LLLT system, one of the best in it’s class is available at the clinic. Low-Level Laser Therapy (LLLT), also known as low-level light therapy or photobiomodulation, has shown promise in the treatment of various skin conditions. Here’s some information about LLLT in the context of skin conditions:

How LLLT Works for Skin Conditions:
LLLT utilizes low-intensity laser or LED light to penetrate the skin’s surface without causing heat or damage. The light energy is absorbed by cells and stimulates various cellular processes. In the case of skin conditions, LLLT may:

1. Promotes Collagen production

2. Reduces Inflammation

3. Accelerates Wound Healing

4. Improves Skin Texture

5. Enhances Blood Circulation

Skin Conditions That Can Benefit from LLLT:
LLLT has been studied and applied in various skin conditions, including:

1. Acne: Blue light can help reduce inflammation associated with acne and promote the healing of acne lesions.

2. Psoriasis:Some studies suggest that LLLT may alleviate the symptoms of psoriasis, including redness and scaling.

3. Rosacea: Red light anti-inflammatory effects may help manage the redness and flushing associated with rosacea.

4. Aging Skin:LLLT is commonly used for anti-aging purposes to improve skin firmness, reduce wrinkles, and enhance overall skin appearance.

5. Scarring

6. Eczema

7. Melasma: Green light can reduce hyperpigmentation. 

Consultation and Safety:
Before undergoing LLLT for a skin condition, it’s crucial to consult with a dermatologist or healthcare professional who specializes in dermatology. They can assess your specific condition, recommend the appropriate treatment parameters, and ensure that LLLT is a suitable option for you. LLLT is generally considered safe, with minimal side effects, but individual responses may vary.

Overall, LLLT can be a valuable adjunct or alternative treatment for various skin conditions, especially when used in conjunction with other dermatological therapies.

The High-Intensity Focused Ultrasound (HIFU) technique targets specific tissues in the body through the use of non-ionizing ultrasonic waves. It is used for a wide range of purposes, including cancer treatment, cosmetic procedures, and treating conditions such as uterine fibroids and essential tremors.

Benefits:-
Comparatively to conventional surgeries, HIFU offers several advantages, including minimal invasiveness, which reduces complications and recovery times. HIFU treatment will help tighten your skin for men’s body shaping. HIFU is the best choice as it tightens the SMAS layer (muscle) of the skin which reverses the sagging appearance. HIFU assists in tightening loose skin around the jowls, improve the appearance of a double chin or “lifting” the brows.

Procedure:-
In HIFU, ultrasound energy is precisely focused on a targeted area, generating heat to destroy or treat localized tissues. Incisions and invasive surgery are not required, reducing the risks associated with traditional procedures. Depending on the specific medical condition, the treatment can be applied externally or internally. 

Consult Dr. Rickson on 31st of this month and get more insights about this treatment for an absolute firm skin.

Absorbable threads, also known as PDO (polydioxanone) threads, are increasingly used in the treatment of male pattern hair loss. These threads are commonly employed in minimally invasive procedures to address hair thinning and promote hair regrowth.

PDO threads are biocompatible and dissolve over time. When strategically inserted into the scalp, they stimulate collagen production and improve blood circulation. This process can enhance the overall health of hair follicles and potentially slow down or reverse hair loss in male pattern baldness.

The threads act as a scaffolding structure, providing support to weakened or damaged hair follicles. As collagen production increases, it contributes to a healthier environment for hair growth. This method is considered a non-surgical option for those seeking to combat male pattern hair loss without undergoing more invasive procedures.

However, it’s essential to consult with a qualified healthcare professional to determine the suitability of absorbable threads for individual cases and to discuss potential risks and benefits. Results can vary, and multiple sessions may be needed for optimal outcomes.  #dermatology #dermatologistconsultation #doctorconsultation #skinconsultation #doctors #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar 
#mumbai #malepatternbaldness #androgeneticalopecia #baldness #hair #alopecia #baldnesstreatment

Hello, sculpted flanks! In your 30s and 40s one may notice accumulation of fat in the flanks despite a good diet and regular exercise. The cause is genetic and age related. It can be one of the toughest spots to eliminate or maintain even after overall body weight reduction and strength training.  Enter Coolsculpting! CoolSculpting is a non-invasive fat reduction treatment that targets and freezes fat cells, allowing the body to naturally eliminate them. When applied to the flanks, commonly known as love handles, CoolSculpting can help reduce localized fat in that area. It's a popular option for those seeking a non-surgical approach to contouring specific areas of the body. Keep in mind that individual results may vary, and it's essential to consult with a qualified healthcare professional to determine if CoolSculpting is the right option for you. You can look forward to better fitting clothes in as quick as a few months. #bodycontouring #coolsculpting #fatfreezing #fatfreeze #lovehandles #lovehandlesbegone

Infectious diseases and post-disease sequelae (cough, debility, pain) can dramatically compromise the quality of life including work performance and general vitality. Adult vaccinations are crucial for preventing and controlling various infectious diseases. Common vaccines for adults include those for influenza, tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis, and shingles. The vaccination schedule may also include vaccines based on factors like age, health conditions, and lifestyle. It’s advisable to consult with a healthcare professional to determine the appropriate vaccinations based on individual health history and risk factors. Regular updates and boosters may be necessary to maintain immunity. Herpes zoster or shingles is one such condition. The condition can itself cause pain and suffering and a significant proportion of individuals can be left with prolonged debilitating pain called post-herpetic neuralgia. Therefore, vaccination against herpes zoster should be considered in those who are immunocompromised or above 50 years of age. Vaccination should be a part of healthy aging lifestyle and includes other lifestyle changes like exercise, healthy diet and adequate sleep. #adultvaccination #shingles #herpeszoster #postherpeticneuralgia #drrickson #drricksonpereira #khar #bandra #mumbai #healthyaging

Treatment results of melasma. Note the improvement in overall tone and texture of the skin in addition to reduction of the melasma. Melasma is a common skin condition characterized by the development of brown patches, typically on the face. It often occurs on the forehead, cheeks, nose, and upper lip. Melasma is mainly genetic. Usually occurs in the 30s or 40s, more often in women than men. Hormonal changes during pregnancy or with birth control pills can trigger it. Sun exposure is a significant factor in its development.

While melasma doesn’t cause any physical harm, it can have a significant impact on one’s appearance. Sun protection, including the use of tinted sunscreen and avoiding excessive sun exposure, is crucial in managing and preventing melasma. Consultation with a dermatologist can help determine the most suitable treatment approach based on individual circumstances. Topical and oral medications are the mainstay of treatment. Peels and lasers are add-ons to enhance results. Management is lifelong with topical creams, serums and tinted sunscreens. #dermatology #doctors #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar

Dr. Rickson Pereira | Dermatologist of the Year | India

Dr Rickson Pereira is a board-certified dermatologist in India with a 14 years post MD experience. His areas of expertise include management of skin, hair and nail diseases like acne, eczema, psoriasis, alopecias, pigmentation; lasers, injectables like botulinum toxin, fillers; threadlifts, and body contouring. His clinic is located in Mumbai and houses cutting edge & world-class lasers, HIFU devices and body contouring devices. He is also a consultant dermatologist at Zennara clinic, Hyderabad and Holy Family hospital, Mumbai.

He is a member of prominent dermatology organisations in India such as the Indian Association of Dermatologists, Venereologists & Leprologists (IADVL), Cosmetic Dermatology Society of India (CDSI) and Asociation of Cutaneous Surgeons of India (ACSI). His clinic caters to wide variety of people including some renowned celebrities from Bollywood, sports, fashion and influencers. He has won awards for his work in psoriasis and received the prestigious Rising star scholarship from the World Congress of Dermatology in 2015 & 2019.

He has published articles and is a reviewer in prominent Indian journals. He has participated as invited faculty and presented multiple papers and posters in national and international conferences including recently at Meidam Dubai in September 2023. He introduced oral minoxidil for alopecias, tofacitinib for managing eczema, psoriasis, alopecia areata and vitiligo and was among the first to use the ixekizumab biologic in psoriasis treatment, and introducing some advanced laser treatments in Mumbai & India. He has actively participated in dermatological research, contributed to scientific advancements and educated the public through workshops and campaigns.

Polydeoxyribonucleotide (PDRN) skin boosters are cosmetic treatments that involve injecting PDRN into the skin. PDRN is derived from salmon DNA and is believed to have tissue-regenerating properties. The injections aim to improve skin hydration, elasticity, and overall appearance by promoting collagen production and stimulating cellular repair.

While some people claim positive results in terms of skin rejuvenation, it’s important to note that scientific evidence supporting the efficacy and safety of PDRN skin boosters is limited. The field of aesthetic medicine is continually evolving, and individual responses to such treatments may vary.

If you are considering PDRN skin boosters or any cosmetic procedure, it’s advisable to consult with a qualified dermatologist or healthcare professional. They can provide personalized advice, discuss potential risks and benefits, and help you make an informed decision based on your skin type and specific concerns.  #dermatology #dermatologistconsultation #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar

Botulinum toxin treatment of the masseter muscle, often referred to as masseter Botox or jawline Botox, is a cosmetic procedure aimed at slimming the lower face and treating conditions related to jaw muscle hypertrophy. Here’s some information:

1. **Purpose:** The primary goal is to reduce the size and strength of the masseter muscles, which can contribute to a squared jaw appearance.

2. **Procedure:** Botulinum toxin, is injected into specific points on each side of the jaw. The toxin is a protein works by temporarily relaxing the muscles, reducing their ability to contract forcefully.

3. **Indications:**
 - **Cosmetic:** Slimming the jawline for aesthetic reasons.
 - **Medical:** Treatment of conditions like bruxism (teeth grinding), temporomandibular joint disorders (TMD), and headaches caused by jaw tension.

4. **Results:** Patients typically start noticing a gradual reduction in jawline fullness within a few weeks. The full effect may take up to a month.

5. **Duration:** The effects are temporary and typically last for about 4-6 months, after which additional treatments may be required to maintain results. 

6. **Side Effects:** Common side effects include temporary bruising, swelling, or mild discomfort at the injection site. Serious complications are rare when the procedure is performed by a qualified and experienced practitioner.

7. **Considerations:** It’s crucial to consult with a trained medical professional, such as a dermatologist or plastic surgeon, for an assessment before undergoing this procedure. Individual results may vary.

Remember that botulinum toxin treatments should only be administered by licensed and experienced professionals in a medical setting. Always prioritize safety and consult with a healthcare provider for personalized advice.  #dermatology #dermatologistconsultation #doctorconsultation #skinconsultation #doctors #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar

Filler injections in the temples are a cosmetic procedure used to restore volume, contour, and rejuvenate the appearance of the temples. Here’s some information about this procedure:

1. **Purpose:** The primary goal of filler injections in the temples is to address volume loss in this area, which can occur due to aging. Hollow or sunken temples can contribute to an aged or gaunt appearance.

2. **Type of Fillers:** Hyaluronic acid dermal fillers are commonly used for temple augmentation. Hyaluronic acid is a naturally occurring substance in the body and is well-tolerated for cosmetic purposes.

3. **Procedure:** The procedure involves injecting the filler strategically into the temples to restore volume and create a more youthful contour. The injections are administered using a fine needle or cannula.

5. **Results:** The effects can last from several months to a year, after which additional injections may be needed to maintain the desired look.

6. **Considerations:** It’s essential to consult with a qualified and experienced healthcare professional, such as a dermatologist or plastic surgeon, before undergoing temple filler injections.

7. **Side Effects:** Common side effects may include temporary redness, swelling, or bruising at the injection site. Serious complications are rare but should be discussed with the treating practitioner.

Always prioritize safety and choose a qualified professional for cosmetic procedures. They can provide personalized advice based on your unique facial anatomy and aesthetic goals. #dermatology #dermatologistconsultation #doctorconsultation #skinconsultation #doctors #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar

Polydeoxyribonucleotide (PDRN) consists of DNA fragments with molecular weights ranging from 50 to 1 500 ​kDa, which are mainly extracted from the sperm cells of salmon trout or chum salmon. Many preclinical and clinical studies have demonstrated the properties of PDRN. These include anti-inflammatory, anti-apoptotic, anti-osteoporotic, anti-melanogenetic, anti-allodynic, anti-osteonecrotic, bone regenerative, tissue damage preventive, anti-ulcerative, and wound healing properties, which are mediated by the activation of the adenosine A2A receptor and salvage pathways. Moreover, PDRN promotes angiogenesis, cellular activity, collagen synthesis, soft tissue regeneration, and skin priming and revitalization and can be used to treat hyperpigmentation.  PDRN can be administered via injections or used via topical serums. This treatment makes the skin brighter, even toned, reduces fines lines and pores and improves overall skin health and radiance. #skinbooster #skinboostertreatment #pdrn #monalisafillers #dermatologist #skindoctor #skinspecialist #drrickson #drricksonpereira #bandra #khar

More and more people living with psoriasis are choosing biologics as a treatment option to manage their psoriasis. There are many options within the biologics basket, so the right one can be chosen for you based on your consultation with a dermatologist. My personal favourite for psoriasis patients is IL-17A inhibitors which require only one or two doses a month and it frees the person of having to apply creams, ointments and shampoos on a daily basis. The incidence of side effects is low and they’re safe to take for long durations. Embrace a life less interrupted by flare-ups.
